cab.content: I\ iI 7THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITAHNIC MAJBSTYfS GOYlRfl. li^l?277SECRET.G-.T.-2246 WAR CABINET,NAVAL OIL FUEL SITUATION.. (See War Cabinet ISO, Minute 8.). Note by the Secretary,With reference to the statement by the 4th Sea Lord oh the Naval Oil Fuel Situation, I shew below the estimated stocks as set cut in G.T0 1233, and the actual stocks on the under-mentioned dates.Dateo Estimated Stock under ApproximateStatement. Go (most"' actual stuck,"favourable forecast,)31st July 512,000 614,00031st August 444,000 655,00030th September 413,000 "700,000On 10th July 202,000 tons were on the way from loading ports and it was estimated that 300,000 tons of shipping would bo available during the ensuing 4 woeks. These figures on 2nd October 1917 had increased to 325,000 and 450,000 tons respectively.In view of the improvement in the situation.as shown above the War Cabinet may be prepared to dispense with further returns unless the position again becomes acute,(Initialled) .M.P.A.H.2 Whitehall Gardens, S.W, 10th October, 1917.
